jade.ui
Class Terminal

java.lang.Object
  jade.ui.Terminal
Direct Known Subclasses:
TermPanel
public abstract class Terminal
extends java.lang.Object

A terminal used for text mode IO. Features a screen buffer with save and recall, the ability to draw camera views on screen, and keyboard input.

Constructor Summary
Terminal()
          Constructs a new Terminal with empty buffers.

Constructor Detail

Terminal

public Terminal()

Method Detail

bufferCamera

public void bufferCamera(Camera camera)
Buffers the view field of the camera at its registered screen center. For each location in the view field, the tile on World of the Camera is buffered relative to the registered screen center. The view field will be buffered regardless of the size on screen, so care should be taken with the way the view field is calculated if a certain size on screen is needed.

Parameters:
camera - the Camera whose fiew view is being buffered

bufferCameras

public final void bufferCameras()
Calls bufferCamera for every Camera registered with the Terminal.

bufferChar

public void bufferChar(Coordinate coord,
                       ColoredChar ch)
Places a character into the buffer at the specified coordinates.

Parameters:
coord - the location of the character in the buffer
ch - the character being buffered

bufferChar

public final void bufferChar(int x,
                             int y,
                             ColoredChar ch)
Places a character into the buffer at the specified coordinates.

Parameters:
x - the x value of the location of the character in the buffer
y - the y value of the location of the character in the buffer
ch - the character being buffered

bufferRelative

public final void bufferRelative(Camera camera,
                                 ColoredChar ch,
                                 Coordinate pos)
Buffers the given ColoredChar relative to the registered screen center of the Camera.

Parameters:
camera - the Camera relative to which the ColoredChar will be buffered
ch - the ColoredChar to buffer
pos - the location of the ColoredChar (on the World}, not the screen)

bufferRelative

public void bufferRelative(Camera camera,
                           ColoredChar ch,
                           int x,
                           int y)
Buffers the given ColoredChar relative to the registered screen center of the Camera.

Parameters:
camera - the Camera relative to which the ColoredChar will be buffered
ch - the ColoredChar to buffer
x - the x value of the location of the ColoredChar (on the World}, not the screen)
y - the y value of the location of the ColoredChar (on the World}, not the screen)

bufferString

public final void bufferString(Coordinate coord,
                               java.lang.String str)
Buffers a String at location on the screen with a default Color of white.

Parameters:
coord - the location of the first character of str
str - the String being buffered

                               java.lang.String str,

Buffers a String at location on the screen with the given Color

Parameters:

str - the String being buffered
color - the Color of the String being buffered

                               int y,

Parameters:

y - the y value of the location of the first character of str
str - the String being buffered

charAt

public ColoredChar charAt(Coordinate coord)
Returns the character at the specified coordinates. Null is returned if nothing is in the buffer.

Parameters:
coord - the location in the buffer being queried
Returns:
the character at the specified coordinates

charAt

public final ColoredChar charAt(int x,
                                int y)
Returns the character at the specified coordinates. Null is returned if nothing is in the buffer.

Parameters:
x - the x value of location in the buffer being queried
y - the y value of location in the buffer being queried
Returns:
the character at the specified coordinates

clearBuffer

public void clearBuffer()
Clears all contents of the buffer.

drawScreen

protected abstract void drawScreen(java.util.Map<Coordinate,ColoredChar> buffer)
Updates the screen to reflect the current state of the buffer using the specific Terminal implementation. Note that the buffer is not actually accessible by implementing classes, but rather a snapshot of the buffer is provided as the parameter to this method. This snapshot is an unmodifiableMap<Coordinate, ColoredChar>.

Parameters:
buffer - a snapshot of the current state of the buffer.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException

getKey

public abstract char getKey()
                     throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Returns the next key press as a char. This method block until a key press is available.

Returns:
the next key press
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException

recallBuffer

public void recallBuffer()
Returns the buffer to the last saved state. A saved state can be made by calling saveBuffer().

refreshScreen

public final void refreshScreen()
Refreshes the screen to reflect the current state of the buffer. Until this method is called, no changes to the buffer should be displayed.

Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException

registerCamera

public void registerCamera(Camera camera,
                           Coordinate screenCenter)
Registers a Camera so that when bufferCamera is called its view field is drawn at the provided screen center.

Parameters:
camera - the Camera being registered
screenCenter - the location on screen where the Camera center will be drawn

registerCamera

public final void registerCamera(Camera camera,
                                 int screenCenterX,
                                 int screenCenterY)
Registers a Camera so that when bufferCamera is called its view field is drawn at the provided screen center.

Parameters:
camera - the Camera being registered
screenCenterX - the x value of the location on screen where the Camera center will be drawn
screenCenterY - the y value of the location on screen where the Camera center will be drawn

saveBuffer

public void saveBuffer()
Saves the current state of the buffer. The buffer can be reverted to this state by calling recallBuffer().

unregisterCamera

public void unregisterCamera(Camera camera)
Unregisters the Camera so that it cannot be drawn on screen.

Parameters:
camera - the Camera being unregistered
